discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
C&D are correct

questions.question_text: A FortiGate is rebooting unexpectedly without any apparent reason. What troubleshooting tools could an administrator use to get more information about the problem? (Choose two.)

An administrator has enabled HA session synchronization in a HA cluster with two members. Which flag is added to a primary unit's session to indicate that it has been synchronized to the secondary unit?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is C.
The synced sessions have the 'synced' flag. The command 'diag sys session list' can be used to see the sessions on the member, with the associated flags.

https://www.catchpoint.com/bgp-monitoring/bgp-states#:~:text=Read%20the%20Blog-,Connect,moves%20to%20the%20Active%20State.
"Connect" state only lasts until the TCP connection is complete.
B is the correct answer.

choices.C: The local peer has received the BGP prefixed from the remote peer.
choices.D: The local peer is receiving the BGP keepalives from the remote peer but it has not received the OpenConfirm yet.
choices.A: The local peer is receiving the BGP keepalives from the remote peer but it has not received any BGP prefix yet.
choices.B: The TCP session for the BGP connection to 10.200.3.1 is down.

choices.A: Those whose traffic matches a DoS policy.
choices.C: Those whose traffic exceeded a threshold of a matching DoS policy.
choices.D: Those whose traffic was detected as an anomaly by an IPS sensor.
choices.B: Those whose traffic matches an IPS sensor.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Dos protection works with thresholds

Selected Answer: C
It's C. The IP address of the host that triggered the anomaly. It can be either the client or the server. For icmp_flood, the IP address is the destination IP address. For icmp_sweep, it would be the source IP address.
